New Colors.name: Polska Włóczka
New Colors.description_miniatur: Whoopsland | Aran/Heavy Worsted | Wełna
New Colors.description: Kolor: Chicken of the Woods Chicken of the Woods to intensywnie złoto-pomarańczowy kolor z brązowymi odcieniami. Chicken of the Woods ma bogaty, złocisty pomarańczowy kolor z brązowymi tonami.
New Colors.second_description: Opis włóczki Czasami błędy prowadzą do czegoś niespodziewanie wspaniałego. Tak było w przypadku Whoopsland, naszej pierwszej próby stworzenia wersji naszej ukochanej włóczki Woodland bez tweedu. Ta luksusowa mieszanka 80% merino i 20% alpaki znajduje idealną równowagę między rustykalnym urokiem a wysublimowaną elegancją. Z wystarczającą ilością alpaki, aby dodać ciepła i miękkości, ta włóczka na bazie merino jest idealna na zimowe ubrania i wystarczająco delikatna do kontaktu z skórą. Jej luźny, delikatny skręt zapewnia doskonałą wydajność termiczną, zwis i wyrazistość ściegów. Podczas produkcji odkryliśmy, że ta wersja bez tweedu miała nieco więcej pilingu niż oczekiwano po farbowaniu. Zamiast ją odrzucić, oferujemy ją po specjalnej obniżonej cenie, umożliwiając Ci korzystanie z włóczki premium w wyjątkowej cenie. Mimo drobnego pilingu, wysoka zawartość merino zapewnia doskonałą wyrazistość ściegów, co sprawia, że jest idealna do teksturowanych lub kablowanych wzorów, niezależnie od tego, czy dążysz do rustykalnego stylu, czy bardziej klasycznego wyglądu. Ta limitowana edycja włóczki jest wystarczająco miękka na akcesoria i wystarczająco uniwersalna do różnych projektów. Nie przegap swojej szansy na doświadczenie Whoopsland – włóczki premium z odrobiną charakteru, dostępnej po przystępnej cenie. Yarn Details: Skład: 80% Wełna Merino, 20% Baby Alpaca Waga: Aran/Heavy Worsted Dopuszczalny Gauges: 4 - 4,75 ściegów = 1 cal na drutach nr 7 - 9 (4,5mm-5,5mm) Gauges na szydełku: 11-14 oczek ścisłych = 4 cali na szydełku nr I - K (5,5 mm-6,5 mm) Długość: 180 jardów Waga: 100 gramów Forma: Hanka Pielęgnacja: Prać ręcznie w zimnej wodzie / suszyć na płasko.

New Colors.name: Chicken of the Woods
New Colors.description_miniatur: Whoopsland | Aran/Heavy Worsted | 80% Merino Wool, 20% Baby Alpaca
New Colors.description:
Color:
            Chicken of the Woods
        

Chicken of the Woods is a rich golden-orange color with brown undertones.
New Colors.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Whoops!  Sometimes mistakes lead to something unexpectedly wonderful. That's the case with Whoopsland, our first attempt at creating a tweed-free version of our beloved Woodland yarn. This luxurious blend of 80% merino and 20% alpaca strikes the perfect balance between rustic charm and refined elegance. With just enough alpaca to add warmth and softness, this Merino-based yarn is ideal for winter wear and gentle enough for next-to-skin projects. Its loose, gentle twist provides excellent thermal efficiency, drape, and stitch definition.

During production, we found that this tweed-free version had slightly more pilling than expected post-dyeing. Rather than letting it go to waste, we’re offering it at a special discounted price, letting you enjoy premium yarn at an exceptional value.

Despite the minor pilling, the high Merino content ensures superb stitch definition, making it perfect for textured or cabled designs, whether you're aiming for a cottage-core vibe or a more classic style. This limited-edition yarn is soft enough for accessories and versatile enough for a variety of projects. Don’t miss your chance to experience Whoopsland—a premium yarn with a bit of added character, available at a budget-friendly price.







                        Yarn Details
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon




Fiber Content:                     80% Merino Wool, 20% Baby Alpaca
                
Weight: Aran/Heavy Worsted

Knitting Gauge:                     4 - 4.75 sts = 1" on #7 - 9 needles (4.5mm-5.5mm)
                
Crochet Gauge:                     11-14 sc = 4'' on I - K hooks (5.5 mm-6.5 mm)
                
Yards:                     180
                
Grams:                     100
                
Put Up:                     Hank
                
Care:                     Hand Wash Cold / Lay Flat to Dry
                








                        Care Instructions
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon

New Colors.name: Bitpop
New Colors.description_miniatur: Swish Pops | DK | 100% Fine Superwash Merino Wool
New Colors.description:
Color:
            Bitpop
        

Bitpop features a dark blue-green, accented by small sections of red, orange, yellow, green, and purple.
New Colors.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Like different music genres combining to create sub-genres, different dye styles play together on Swish Pops to create colorful and carefree variegated hanks. Speckles and hand-painted color are splashed across incredibly-soft DK-weight Swish, making Swish Pops the perfect companion for solid-color Swish DK. Mix and match Swish Pops with Swish DK to add a hand-painted touch to multi-color projects or use Swish Pops on its own to crochet vibrant accessories, baby gifts, or sweaters.

View the entire Swish family here.
Note: For best machine wash results, turn the garment inside out (when possible), and wash separately in cold water on a delicate cycle. You may want to wash projects made from darker colors by themselves for the first few washes in case the yarn bleeds a bit.







                        Yarn Details
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon




Fiber Content:                     100% Fine Superwash Merino Wool
                
Weight: DK

Knitting Gauge:                     5.5 sts = 1" on #5 needles (3.75mm)
                
Crochet Gauge:                     12 - 17 sc = 4'' on 7-I hooks
                
Yards:                     246
                
Grams:                     100
                
Put Up:                     Hank
                
Care:                     Machine Wash Gentle Cold / Tumble Dry Low
                








                        Care Instructions
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon

New Colors.name: Chance of Rain
New Colors.description_miniatur: Gossy | Sport | 65% Cupro, 35% Fine Merino Wool
New Colors.description:
Color:
            Chance of Rain
        

Chance of Rain is a bright slate gray color, similar to the sky's reflection on a spring rain puddle.
New Colors.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Gossy is a transitional season yarn blend that combines the sustainable elegance of Cupro with the softness and warmth of fine Merino wool. Crafted for discerning makers, this luxurious yarn offers an eco-conscious alternative without compromising quality or aesthetic appeal.
With 65% Cupro—a hypoallergenic, breathable, and moisture-regulating fiber—paired with 35% fine Merino wool, this yarn is perfect for knitters and crocheters who love year-round projects. The blend makes a gorgeous fabric with exceptional drape, sheen, and elasticity, making it ideal for everything from lightweight garments to cozy accessories.
This yarn is great for:

lightweight sweaters
colorful accessories
projects for all seasons








                        Yarn Details
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon




Fiber Content:                     65% Cupro, 35% Fine Merino Wool
                
Weight: Sport

Knitting Gauge:                     6 - 6.75 sts = 1" on #3 - 5 needles
                
Crochet Gauge:                     17 - 22 sc = 4'' on E-7 (3.5-4.5mm) hooks
                
Yards:                     142
                
Grams:                     50
                
Put Up:                     Ball
                
Care:                     Hand Wash Cold / Lay Flat to Dry
                








                        Care Instructions
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon

Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon

Woodnote’s blend of wool from three different sheep breeds creates a springy yarn with all of the best characteristics of wool. Bluefaced Leicester provides luster, drape, and durability; Masham provides a hint of sheen and loftiness; and Merino provides luxurious softness. This luxury British breed blend is a staple yarn in any stash, with each shade inspired by English woodland. This soft yarn is comfortably worn next to the skin, making it ideal for sweaters, scarves, and hats.
Bluefaced Leicester: Evolved during the last century in the Tyne & Wear Valleys and the hills of east Cumbria, this breed produces fine, long-staple wool that is known for its softness and luster. As well as being soft, this fiber also holds the strength needed to create long-lasting garments that can be treasured over time. With a broad muzzle and tightly curled, semi-lustrous wool, it is the dark blue skin on the sheep’s head that gave the breed its name.
Masham: Produced by crossing a Teeswater or Wensleydale ram with a Northern hill ewe such as the Swaledale or Dalesbred, this hardy sheep produces a soft, demi-luster fleece.
Merino: Developed in Spain, Merino sheep are world famous for having one of the highest quality fleece of any breed of sheep. The short and fine fibers used in Merino yarn create a luxurious and soft texture that has all the resilience needed to create a long-lasting piece of knitwear.

New Colors.name: Daring Hand Paint
New Colors.description_miniatur: Muse Aran | Aran/Heavy Worsted | 100% Superwash Merino Wool
New Colors.description:
Color:
            Daring Hand Paint
        

Daring Hand Paint is a soft pastel blend of bubblegum pink, mint green, smoky lilac, and pale yellow.
New Colors.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Be prepared to be inspired by the hand-painted masterpieces of Muse, our artfully crafted superwash aran weight Merino wool yarn from Japan. The wonderfully soft and touchable Merino is firmly twisted in a single strand, stable enough to discourage splitting and pilling, while still enjoying the finish and drape of single-ply construction—with special care taken to ensure even thickness. At approx. 8 wraps per inch, the yard-to-weight ratio can be deceiving, with extra weight from the dense twist knitting into a satisfying and substantial fabric. With machine washable convenience, you'll enjoy easy care hats, cowls, and accessories with next-to-skin softness, or sweaters and garments bursting with color.

Meticulously hand-dyed by artisans, each skein of Muse is a study in the art of masterful color blending. The multi-colored hand-painted colorways are achieved by the blending of just 3 basic colors, applied with precision, which minimizes the streaking and pooling other hand-painted yarns are prone to. Functioning almost as solids, our tonal varieties are ideal for use in projects that feature textural stitches and cables, as the subtle variations in tone emphasize stitches and bring extra depth.

Please note: As a hand-painted yarn, colors may vary from skein to skein.







                        Yarn Details
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon

New Colors.description:
Color:
            Acorn
        

Acorn is a warm brown shade with orange undertones.
New Colors.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Ewe & Billy is a two-ply DK weight yarn featuring 25% kid mohair and 75% merino wool, representing the pinnacle of luxury and practicality in knitting and crochet materials. With its exceptional warmth, softness, durability, and versatility, this blend offers stitchers the opportunity to create beautiful, long-lasting garments and accessories that are as stylish as they are comfortable. 

By combining kid mohair with merino wool, we have created a yarn that not only feels luxurious but also boasts exceptional durability and wearability. Mohair's fine fibers, when blended with merino wool, result in a yarn that is stronger and more resilient than pure mohair. This ensures that the knitted items retain their shape and integrity even after repeated use and washing.
Whether crafting cozy winter sweaters, lightweight summer tops, or stylish accessories, our blend offers the perfect balance of warmth, breathability, and comfort for year-round wear.







                        Yarn Details
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon




Fiber Content:                     75% Merino Wool, 25% Kid Mohair
                
Weight: DK

Knitting Gauge:                     5.5 - 6 sts =1" on #4 - 7 needles (3.5mm - 4.5mm)
                
Crochet Gauge:                     13 - 18 sts = 4" on 7-I hooks (4.5mm - 5.5mm)
                
Yards:                     273
                
Grams:                     100
                
Put Up:                     Hank
                
Care:                     Hand Wash Cold / Lay Flat to Dry

                    Plus Icon

Aran yarn is the original 100% wool yarn traditionally used to knit cable sweaters in coastal regions of Britain and Ireland, with the Irish island of Aran giving it its name. Aran yarn has always been worsted spun and hank dyed—this yarn line follows these traditional methods with an additional organic-based softener that’s applied after dying. The shades in this range are inspired by fishermen and the coastline.

Be prepared to be inspired by the hand-painted masterpieces of Muse, our artfully crafted superwash aran weight Merino wool yarn from Japan. The wonderfully soft and touchable Merino is firmly twisted in a single strand, stable enough to discourage splitting and pilling, while still enjoying the finish and drape of single-ply construction—with special care taken to ensure even thickness. At approx. 8 wraps per inch, the yard-to-weight ratio can be deceiving, with extra weight from the dense twist knitting into a satisfying and substantial fabric. With machine washable convenience, you'll enjoy easy care hats, cowls, and accessories with next-to-skin softness, or sweaters and garments bursting with color.

Meticulously hand-dyed by artisans, each skein of Muse is a study in the art of masterful color blending. The multi-colored hand-painted colorways are achieved by the blending of just 3 basic colors, applied with precision, which minimizes the streaking and pooling other hand-painted yarns are prone to. Functioning almost as solids, our tonal varieties are ideal for use in projects that feature textural stitches and cables, as the subtle variations in tone emphasize stitches and bring extra depth.

Please note: As a hand-painted yarn, colors may vary from skein to skein.

New Colors.description:

New Colors.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Ewe & Billy is a two-ply DK weight yarn featuring 25% kid mohair and 75% merino wool, representing the pinnacle of luxury and practicality in knitting and crochet materials. With its exceptional warmth, softness, durability, and versatility, this blend offers stitchers the opportunity to create beautiful, long-lasting garments and accessories that are as stylish as they are comfortable. 

By combining kid mohair with merino wool, we have created a yarn that not only feels luxurious but also boasts exceptional durability and wearability. Mohair's fine fibers, when blended with merino wool, result in a yarn that is stronger and more resilient than pure mohair. This ensures that the knitted items retain their shape and integrity even after repeated use and washing.
Whether crafting cozy winter sweaters, lightweight summer tops, or stylish accessories, our blend offers the perfect balance of warmth, breathability, and comfort for year-round wear.

Minus Icon

New Colors.name: Conker
New Colors.description_miniatur: Baa Ram Ewe Woodnote Aran | Aran/Heavy Worsted | 34% Blue Faced Leicester, 33% Masham, 33% Merino
New Colors.description:
Color:
            Conker
        

Conker is a warm chestnut brown with an orange undertone.
New Colors.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Woodnote’s blend of wool from three different sheep breeds creates a springy yarn with all of the best characteristics of wool. Bluefaced Leicester provides luster, drape, and durability; Masham provides a hint of sheen and loftiness; and Merino provides luxurious softness. This luxury British breed blend is a staple yarn in any stash, with each shade inspired by English woodland. This soft yarn is comfortably worn next to the skin, making it ideal for sweaters, scarves, and hats.
Bluefaced Leicester: Evolved during the last century in the Tyne & Wear Valleys and the hills of east Cumbria, this breed produces fine, long-staple wool that is known for its softness and luster. As well as being soft, this fiber also holds the strength needed to create long-lasting garments that can be treasured over time. With a broad muzzle and tightly curled, semi-lustrous wool, it is the dark blue skin on the sheep’s head that gave the breed its name.
Masham: Produced by crossing a Teeswater or Wensleydale ram with a Northern hill ewe such as the Swaledale or Dalesbred, this hardy sheep produces a soft, demi-luster fleece.
Merino: Developed in Spain, Merino sheep are world famous for having one of the highest quality fleece of any breed of sheep. The short and fine fibers used in Merino yarn create a luxurious and soft texture that has all the resilience needed to create a long-lasting piece of knitwear.







                        Yarn Details
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon




Fiber Content:                     34% Blue Faced Leicester, 33% Masham, 33% Merino
                
Weight: Aran/Heavy Worsted

Knitting Gauge:                     4 - 4.75 sts = 1" on #7 - 9 needles (4.5mm-5.5mm)
                
Crochet Gauge:                     11 -14 sc = 4'' on I - K hooks (5.5mm-6.5mm)
                
Yards:                     168
                
Grams:                     100
                
Put Up:                     Hank
                
Care:                     Hand Wash / Dry Flat

As well as being soft, this fiber also holds the strength needed to create long-lasting garments that can be treasured over time. With a broad muzzle and tightly curled, semi-lustrous wool, it is the dark blue skin on the sheep’s head that gave the breed its name.
Masham: Produced by crossing a Teeswater or Wensleydale ram with a Northern hill ewe such as the Swaledale or Dalesbred, this hardy sheep produces a soft, demi-luster fleece.
Merino: Developed in Spain, Merino sheep are world famous for having one of the highest quality fleece of any breed of sheep. The short and fine fibers used in Merino yarn create a luxurious and soft texture that has all the resilience needed to create a long-lasting piece of knitwear.







                        Yarn Details
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon




Fiber Content:                     34% Blue Faced Leicester, 33% Masham, 33% Merino
                
Weight: Aran/Heavy Worsted

Knitting Gauge:                     4 - 4.75 sts = 1" on #7 - 9 needles (4.5mm-5.5mm)
                
Crochet Gauge:                     11 -14 sc = 4'' on I - K hooks (5.5mm-6.5mm)
                
Yards:                     168
                
Grams:                     100
                
Put Up:                     Hank
                
Care:                     Hand Wash / Dry Flat

                    Plus Icon

Ewe & Billy is a two-ply DK weight yarn featuring 25% kid mohair and 75% merino wool, representing the pinnacle of luxury and practicality in knitting and crochet materials. With its exceptional warmth, softness, durability, and versatility, this blend offers stitchers the opportunity to create beautiful, long-lasting garments and accessories that are as stylish as they are comfortable. 

By combining kid mohair with merino wool, we have created a yarn that not only feels luxurious but also boasts exceptional durability and wearability. Mohair's fine fibers, when blended with merino wool, result in a yarn that is stronger and more resilient than pure mohair. This ensures that the knitted items retain their shape and integrity even after repeated use and washing.
Whether crafting cozy winter sweaters, lightweight summer tops, or stylish accessories, our blend offers the perfect balance of warmth, breathability, and comfort for year-round wear.

New Colors.name: Innovative Hand Paint
New Colors.description_miniatur: Muse Aran | Aran/Heavy Worsted | 100% Superwash Merino Wool
New Colors.description:
Color:
            Innovative Hand Paint
        

Innovative Hand Paint is a bright cyan color with accents of light teal.
New Colors.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Be prepared to be inspired by the hand-painted masterpieces of Muse, our artfully crafted superwash aran weight Merino wool yarn from Japan. The wonderfully soft and touchable Merino is firmly twisted in a single strand, stable enough to discourage splitting and pilling, while still enjoying the finish and drape of single-ply construction—with special care taken to ensure even thickness. At approx. 8 wraps per inch, the yard-to-weight ratio can be deceiving, with extra weight from the dense twist knitting into a satisfying and substantial fabric. With machine washable convenience, you'll enjoy easy care hats, cowls, and accessories with next-to-skin softness, or sweaters and garments bursting with color.

Meticulously hand-dyed by artisans, each skein of Muse is a study in the art of masterful color blending. The multi-colored hand-painted colorways are achieved by the blending of just 3 basic colors, applied with precision, which minimizes the streaking and pooling other hand-painted yarns are prone to. Functioning almost as solids, our tonal varieties are ideal for use in projects that feature textural stitches and cables, as the subtle variations in tone emphasize stitches and bring extra depth.

Please note: As a hand-painted yarn, colors may vary from skein to skein.







                        Yarn Details
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon




Fiber Content:                     100% Superwash Merino Wool
                
Weight: Aran/Heavy Worsted

Knitting Gauge:                     4 - 4.5 sts = 1" on #7 -10 needles (4.5mm-5.5mm)
                
Crochet Gauge:                     11 - 14 sts sc = 4"on I - K hooks
                
Yards:                     114
                
Grams:                     100
                
Put Up:                     Hank
                
Care:                     Machine Wash Gentle Cold / Tumble Dry Low

Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon

Ewe & Billy is a two-ply DK weight yarn featuring 25% kid mohair and 75% merino wool, representing the pinnacle of luxury and practicality in knitting and crochet materials. With its exceptional warmth, softness, durability, and versatility, this blend offers stitchers the opportunity to create beautiful, long-lasting garments and accessories that are as stylish as they are comfortable. 

By combining kid mohair with merino wool, we have created a yarn that not only feels luxurious but also boasts exceptional durability and wearability. Mohair's fine fibers, when blended with merino wool, result in a yarn that is stronger and more resilient than pure mohair. This ensures that the knitted items retain their shape and integrity even after repeated use and washing.
Whether crafting cozy winter sweaters, lightweight summer tops, or stylish accessories, our blend offers the perfect balance of warmth, breathability, and comfort for year-round wear.

New Colors.description:

New Colors.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Woodnote’s blend of wool from three different sheep breeds creates a springy yarn with all of the best characteristics of wool. Bluefaced Leicester provides luster, drape, and durability; Masham provides a hint of sheen and loftiness; and Merino provides luxurious softness. This luxury British breed blend is a staple yarn in any stash, with each shade inspired by English woodland. This soft yarn is comfortably worn next to the skin, making it ideal for sweaters, scarves, and hats.
Bluefaced Leicester: Evolved during the last century in the Tyne & Wear Valleys and the hills of east Cumbria, this breed produces fine, long-staple wool that is known for its softness and luster. As well as being soft, this fiber also holds the strength needed to create long-lasting garments that can be treasured over time. With a broad muzzle and tightly curled, semi-lustrous wool, it is the dark blue skin on the sheep’s head that gave the breed its name.
Masham: Produced by crossing a Teeswater or Wensleydale ram with a Northern hill ewe such as the Swaledale or Dalesbred, this hardy sheep produces a soft, demi-luster fleece.
Merino: Developed in Spain, Merino sheep are world famous for having one of the highest quality fleece of any breed of sheep. The short and fine fibers used in Merino yarn create a luxurious and soft texture that has all the resilience needed to create a long-lasting piece of knitwear.

New Colors.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Be prepared to be inspired by the hand-painted masterpieces of Muse, our artfully crafted superwash aran weight Merino wool yarn from Japan. The wonderfully soft and touchable Merino is firmly twisted in a single strand, stable enough to discourage splitting and pilling, while still enjoying the finish and drape of single-ply construction—with special care taken to ensure even thickness. At approx. 8 wraps per inch, the yard-to-weight ratio can be deceiving, with extra weight from the dense twist knitting into a satisfying and substantial fabric. With machine washable convenience, you'll enjoy easy care hats, cowls, and accessories with next-to-skin softness, or sweaters and garments bursting with color.

Meticulously hand-dyed by artisans, each skein of Muse is a study in the art of masterful color blending. The multi-colored hand-painted colorways are achieved by the blending of just 3 basic colors, applied with precision, which minimizes the streaking and pooling other hand-painted yarns are prone to. Functioning almost as solids, our tonal varieties are ideal for use in projects that feature textural stitches and cables, as the subtle variations in tone emphasize stitches and bring extra depth.

Please note: As a hand-painted yarn, colors may vary from skein to skein.

An all-time bestseller, Wool of the Andes Worsted is our iconic workhorse wool! Made from 100% Peruvian Highland wool, it’s the perfect yarn for projects that will get used daily, like your favorite sweater, hat, or blanket. Peruvian Highland wool is a strong fiber that has an excellent balance of structure, loft, and drape. Wonderfully warm for all weather, this sturdy, all-purpose yarn has excellent stitch definition and heirloom durability. As a worsted weight yarn, it’s a happy medium weight that’s commonly used for everything from garments to home goods, and Wool of the Andes’ extensive color palette is just as versatile as the yarn itself, with dozens of solids and heathers to choose from.
Wool of the Andes Worsted also comes in Wool of the Andes Tweed Worsted, which can be mixed and matched with solids and heathers. It’s also available in Wool of the Andes Superwash Worsted for easy care projects.

View All.name: Wool of the Andes Tweed Worsted
View All.description_miniatur: Worsted | 80% Peruvian Highland Wool, 20% Donegal Tweed
View All.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Add extra texture and depth to your handmade items with Wool of the Andes Tweed Worsted! This tweed combines a classic heathered palette with earthy-colored flecks of Donegal tweed–viscose and acrylic neps that are spun alongside the Peruvian Highland wool. The tweedy Donegal neps add a rustic and traditional appeal to everything from cabled pullovers to outdoorsy hats and mitts. Wonderfully warm for all weather, this sturdy, all-purpose yarn has excellent stitch definition and heirloom durability.  As a worsted weight yarn, it’s a happy medium weight that’s commonly used for everything from garments to home goods, and Wool of the Andes’ heathered color palette with neutral-colored neps looks as cozy as your finished pieces will feel.
Use Wool of the Andes Tweed Worsted to create bouncy cables, gorgeous textures, or beautiful colorwork. As a "sticky" wool–meaning the fibers grip lightly together–Wool of the Andes is an ideal choice for colorwork because stitches "stick" in place and won’t shift or loosen as you work, and the wide selection of saturated colors provides a wonderful palette for projects. 50g balls make it easy to add a wide variety of colors to your projects without waste, and for larger single-color projects, this sticky wool will splice together with ease when using the felted join. In addition to being great for projects where your stitches are on display, Wool of the Andes also felts beautifully with warm water and agitation, creating a dense, durable fabric with structure for felted slippers, bags, and beyond.
Wool of the Andes Tweed Worsted also comes in solids and heathers without neps as Wool of the Andes Worsted, and the two yarns can be mixed and matched to create an even wider selection of options for multicolor projects. 







                        Yarn Details
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon

                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



For projects that take no time, truly make a statement, and can provide warmth on the worst of winter days, reach for Wool of the Andes Bulky! Made from 100% Peruvian Highland wool, it’s a heavy-weight yarn that works up quickly into thick, cozy projects. Peruvian Highland wool is a strong fiber that has an excellent balance of structure, loft, and drape, and this sturdy, all-purpose yarn has excellent stitch definition and heirloom durability. As a bulky-weight yarn, it creates a cushy, irresistible, thick fabric that stitches up in a flash, making it perfect for last-minute gifts, speedy sweaters, and quick accessories. Wool of the Andes’ curated color palette is just as versatile as the yarn itself, with a mix of solids and heathers to choose from.
Use Wool of the Andes to create bouncy cables, gorgeous textures, or beautiful colorwork. As a "sticky" wool–meaning the fibers grip lightly together–Wool of the Andes Bulky is a great choice for colorwork because stitches "stick" in place and won’t shift or loosen as you work, and the curated selection of saturated colors provides a wonderful palette for projects. In addition to being great for projects where your stitches are on display, Wool of the Andes also felts beautifully with warm water and agitation, creating a dense, durable fabric with structure for felted slippers, bags, and beyond.
For a convenient, machine-washable option, try Wool of the Andes Superwash Bulky.

View All.description_miniatur: DK | 55% Merino Wool, 25% Superfine Alpaca, 20% Donegal Tweed
View All.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



City Tweed yarn begins with alpaca and Merino fibers dyed two different colors and then blended together to make a subtly rich, lustrous heather. We chose neutral color Donegal tweed neps to incorporate into the 2-ply yarn. Donegal is a series of viscose neps (think slubs or bits of lint) that are suspended in a very fine acrylic mesh which allows them to be spun alongside the longer alpaca and Merino fibers. In the yarn, you won't be able to see the acrylic web at all, and the neps will appear either on the surface of the yarn or spun inside the yarn strand. The high ratio of neps gives City Tweed a traditional appeal. The use of Merino and alpaca makes it soft and warm. This weight is gorgeous in two-color knitting.

Lighten up your projects with your favorite 100% Peruvian Highland wool by using Wool of the Andes Sport! Peruvian Highland wool is a strong fiber that has an excellent balance of structure, loft, and drape, and Wool of the Andes Sport is our finest-gauge yarn available in the Wool of the Andes family. Wool of the Andes’ extensive color palette is just as versatile as the yarn itself, with dozens of solids and heathers to choose from.
Use Wool of the Andes to create bouncy cables, gorgeous textures, or beautiful colorwork. As a "sticky" wool–meaning the fibers grip lightly together–Wool of the Andes Sport is an ideal choice for both stranded colorwork and intarsia because stitches "stick" in place and won’t shift or loosen as you work, and the wide selection of saturated colors provides a wonderful palette for projects. 50g balls make it easy to add a wide variety of colors to your projects without waste, and for larger single-color projects, this sticky wool will splice together with ease when using the felted join. In addition to being great for projects where your stitches are on display, Wool of the Andes also felts beautifully with warm water and agitation, creating a dense, durable fabric with structure for felted slippers, bags, and beyond.

                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



You won’t be able to keep your hands off this soft, bouncy, bulky yarn! Alla Prima (formerly known as Array Super Bulky) is a chunky single-ply yarn made up of 100% Merino and beautiful, vivid colors.
The hand-painted colorways are the highlight of Alla Prima, which is named after a classic painting technique. Some hand-painted shades feature a wash of color on the cream base to coordinate with the hand-painted colors and other shades let the natural wool act as a neutral base for the vivid colors.  Hand-painted Alla Prima comes in hanks like it was dyed, and each hank is its own work of art.
Alla Prima also comes in coordinating solids, dyed with the same colors used for the multicolor hand-painted skeins. Incredibly soft and richly colored, it’s a yarn you’ll want to cuddle up with, making it a great choice for quick, dramatic cowls, scarves, and hats. Solid Alla Prima is conveniently put up in donut balls that require no rewinding.
Note: Due to the heavy saturation of the hand-painted colors, some bleeding may occur when washing. As a hand-painted yarn, colors may vary from skein to skein

View All.name: Hawthorne Fingering
View All.description_miniatur: Fingering | 80% Fine Superwash Highland Wool, 20% Polyamide (Nylon)
View All.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



A reflection of the great Northwest, Hawthorne is a yarn inspired by the varied and vibrant place we call home. This sturdy, colorful, superwash sock yarn is made up of a blend of superwash wool for comfort and warmth and nylon for strength. Together they make a beautiful canvas for colors that range from bright and playful to moody and sophisticated. A classic high twist gives this the bounce and resilience, great for the projects Hawthorne does best: unique socks, stunning shawls, and soft yet durable accessories. It even makes beautiful garments, like sweaters and shells, where its hand-crafted colors can get the attention they deserve.

Hawthorne comes in four dye styles, each as beautiful as the next, and they mix and match beautifully for projects that use multiple colors.

Kettle Dyed – Skeins of Hawthorne Kettle Dyed are fully submerged in a large vessel, and then dye is added with minimal agitation to create beautiful semi-solid shades.
Multi – Hawthorne Multi is hand-painted to intentionally create surprising pops of color and variegation. 
Tonal – To create the complex tonal colors of Hawthorne Tonal, dyes in multiple shades are hand-painted on each skein. 
Speckle – Another hand-painted yarn, Hawthorne Speckle had dye speckled over each hank to create fun sprinkles of color. 

Please note that due to the dye methods used, colors may vary from skein to skein.

Create richly colored, 100% cotton projects with Vividie! With beautiful sheen, saturated colors, and crisp stitch definition, Vividie is the perfect yarn for summer tops, transitional sweaters, and light accessories. The sophisticated color palette was chosen with handmade wardrobes in mind, featuring gorgeous neutrals, deep jewel tones, and a few pops of bright color. We know you’ll want to wear pieces made with this breathable, soft yarn every day!
Vividie is made with 100% mercerized cotton. The mercerization process smoothes the outer layer of the cotton fibers, which creates an incredible sheen and also allows the mercerized cotton to absorb more dye and shed less lint. The one drawback to mercerized cotton is that it’s less absorbent than regular cotton, so we don’t recommend using Vividie for washcloths.

                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



City Tweed begins with alpaca and Merino fibers dyed two different colors and then blended together to make a subtly rich, lustrous heather. We chose neutral color Donegal tweed neps to incorporate into the 2-ply yarn. Donegal is a series of viscose neps (think slubs or bits of lint) that are suspended in a very fine acrylic mesh which allows them to be spun alongside the longer alpaca and Merino fibers. In the yarn, you won't be able to see the acrylic web at all, and the neps will appear either on the surface of the yarn or spun inside the yarn strand. The high ratio of neps gives City Tweed a traditional appeal. The use of Merino and alpaca makes it soft and warm.

Dishie Cone is the same worsted cotton yarn you know and love, just that much more! The 400g cones are great for larger projects such as rugs, towels, throws, and even weaving. With fewer skeins to manage and ends to weave in, our favorite kitchen yarn is more convenient than ever.

Debuting in 2005, Andean Treasure was one of our first exclusive luxury yarns, and the decades of gorgeous projects created with it make it easy to see why it continues to be so beloved!

Timeless heathered colors add depth and complexity to one of Peru’s finest fibers to create a yarn that is as much a treat to craft with as it is to wear. Made of Peruvian baby alpaca, Andean Treasure both looks and feels luxurious with beautiful drape and hand feel. When producing alpaca yarns, alpaca fibers are sorted by their diameter (micron count), and the finest fibers are the softest. Baby alpaca is one of the softest and finest classifications of alpaca, and it's also a delightfully warm, and cozy fiber, holding in heat better than sheep’s wool. Andean Treasure is a decadent choice for next-to-skin winter accessories like scarves, cowls, hats, and headbands, and it looks particularly nice in lacy stitch patterns. For some quiet luxury, try Andean Treasure for felting projects, like felted slippers.
 
Looking for Bare, undyed Andean Treasure DK? Find it here!

We’ve reclassified Andean Treasure as a DK weight yarn based on customer feedback, but this is the same Andean Treasure you know and love, with the same yardage and grams per ball.

By selecting high-grade Merino wool (20.5 microns), we have been able to produce a machine-washable yarn that is super soft—definitely worthy of being worn against a baby's skin. Just the ticket for children's clothes, afghans, charity projects, and gifts. No need to worry about the care your hard work will receive since this yarn can be machine-washed and will come out even softer than before!

Swish Bulky is a heavy-weight yarn so soft and lofty that "bulky" seems like a misnomer. Large enough to give the squishy extra fine merino room to fully breathe and bloom, this yarn crochets up in no time into the softest, springiest accessories and garments. For quick hats that you'll want against your forehead and cowls that are as convenient as they feel decadent, Swish Bulky will have you swooning.
View the entire Swish family here.
Note: For best machine wash results, turn the garment inside out (when possible), and wash separately in cold water on a delicate cycle. You may want to wash projects made from darker colors by themselves for the first few washes in case the yarn bleeds a bit.

Whoops!  Sometimes mistakes lead to something unexpectedly wonderful. That's the case with Whoopsland, our first attempt at creating a tweed-free version of our beloved Woodland yarn. This luxurious blend of 80% merino and 20% alpaca strikes the perfect balance between rustic charm and refined elegance. With just enough alpaca to add warmth and softness, this Merino-based yarn is ideal for winter wear and gentle enough for next-to-skin projects. Its loose, gentle twist provides excellent thermal efficiency, drape, and stitch definition.

During production, we found that this tweed-free version had slightly more pilling than expected post-dyeing. Rather than letting it go to waste, we’re offering it at a special discounted price, letting you enjoy premium yarn at an exceptional value.

Despite the minor pilling, the high Merino content ensures superb stitch definition, making it perfect for textured or cabled designs, whether you're aiming for a cottage-core vibe or a more classic style. This limited-edition yarn is soft enough for accessories and versatile enough for a variety of projects. Don’t miss your chance to experience Whoopsland—a premium yarn with a bit of added character, available at a budget-friendly price.

Practical enough for the campfire and cozy enough for the couch, Woodland Tweed is a merino-alpaca blend that strikes a fine balance between rustic and refined. With just enough alpaca to take best advantage of that downy fiber’s warmth and softness, this largely Merino yarn is warm enough for woodland winters and soft enough to wear against the skin. Gently spun into a loose twist, the downy fibers are given enough play to provide both thermal efficiency and flattering drape, while still maintaining the structure necessary for excellent stitch definition and durability.

Lightly tweedy, neutrally-colored viscose neps are just present enough to create a subtly rustic look in every colorway. Because of its high Merino content, Woodland Tweed makes bouncy cables and textured stitch patterns that pop, and paired with its woodsy color palette, it’s a great choice for cabled pullovers and gansey sweaters, whether your taste is cottagecore or classic! As well as being perfect for warm sweaters and garments of all sorts, this versatile yarn is also soft enough for accessories worn against the skin.

View All.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



As nice to touch as it is for the environment, Oceana is a fluffy dream! With a blend of soft, superfine alpaca and polyester SEAQUAL ® YARN made from Upcycled Marine Plastic, this yarn feels decadent and will warm both your body and heart. Oceana features a chainette construction with the alpaca loosely incorporated to trap more air and make a warm, light, fluffy yarn. The polyester and alpaca are dyed contrasting colors before plying, which helps emphasize the alpaca halo and adds dimension. With its bright colors, Oceana is ideal for warm accessories and sweaters that make a big statement!
This yarn was created with SEAQUAL INITIATIVE. SEAQUAL INITIATIVE works with NGOs, fishermen, authorities, and local communities to help clean our oceans. Marine litter from our beaches, ocean floor & surface, rivers & estuaries, is collected by clean-up programs. It is then sorted into different material types and the plastic portion is cleaned and transformed into Upcycled Marine Plastic. Environmentally conscious brands and manufacturers then transform this new, fully-traceable raw material into inspiring sustainable products for every aspect of our lives. Consumer purchasing power is one of the most powerful tools for change. In choosing products containing Upcycled Marine Plastic, you are helping to clean our oceans. 
Learn more about SEAQUAL INITIATIVE.

Made from a combination of baby alpaca, yak, and superwash Merino wool, Yakish is a 2-ply sport weight yarn with a luxurious texture and beautiful drape.  This fiber fusion is an innovative combination that offers a wealth of unique properties, resulting in a yarn that is exceptionally soft, warm, and versatile—perfect for a wide range of knitting and crochet projects. Knit and crocheted fabrics have a subtle halo and gentle sheen, giving them an elegant and sophisticated appearance. The nature of the fiber blend also adds a natural melange to the colors.
Despite its natural warmth and insulation, Yakish is surprisingly versatile and suitable for all seasons. Baby Alpaca's natural breathability helps your finished project feel very light & airy.
Perfect for projects like lightweight tops, shawls, and accessories you'll stay comfortable without the added bulk, thanks to the Baby Alpaca. The addition of Yak fiber provides exceptional warmth and insulation, making it ideal for cold-weather projects, like sweaters and hats. Yak fiber is renowned for its thermal-regulating properties, effectively trapping body heat to keep you warm in chilly temperatures without feeling bulky or heavy. Whether crocheting for winter or summer, Yakish offers the perfect balance of warmth, breathability, and comfort, allowing you to enjoy your handmade creations year-round.

Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Be prepared to be inspired by the hand-painted masterpieces of Muse, our artfully crafted superwash aran weight Merino wool yarn from Japan. The wonderfully soft and touchable Merino is firmly twisted in a single strand, stable enough to discourage splitting and pilling, while still enjoying the finish and drape of single-ply construction—with special care taken to ensure even thickness. At approx. 8 wraps per inch, the yard-to-weight ratio can be deceiving, with extra weight from the dense twist knitting into a satisfying and substantial fabric. With machine washable convenience, you'll enjoy easy care hats, cowls, and accessories with next-to-skin softness, or sweaters and garments bursting with color.

Meticulously hand-dyed by artisans, each skein of Muse is a study in the art of masterful color blending. The multi-colored hand-painted colorways are achieved by the blending of just 3 basic colors, applied with precision, which minimizes the streaking and pooling other hand-painted yarns are prone to. Functioning almost as solids, our tonal varieties are ideal for use in projects that feature textural stitches and cables, as the subtle variations in tone emphasize stitches and bring extra depth.

Please note: As a hand-painted yarn, colors may vary from skein to skein.

View All.name: Hawthorne DK
View All.description_miniatur: DK | 80% Fine Superwash Highland Wool, 20% Polyamide (Nylon)
View All.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



The bold colors of Hawthorne make an even bigger statement on a DK-weight yarn! A reflection of the great Northwest, Hawthorne is a yarn inspired by the varied and vibrant place we call home. This sturdy, colorful, superwash yarn is made up of a blend of superwash wool for comfort and warmth and nylon for strength. Together they make a beautiful canvas for colors that range from bright and playful to moody and sophisticated. A classic high twist gives this the bounce and resilience, great for projects that are both sturdy and make a statement. Use this DK-weight version of Hawthorne for heavy socks and slippers, midweight accessories, easy-care blankets, and gorgeous sweaters.
Hawthorne DK features the best of Hawthorne Fingering colors and comes in four dye styles, each as beautiful as the next. Mix and match dye styles to create stunning multicolor projects.
Kettle Dyed – Skeins of Hawthorne Kettle Dyed are fully submerged in a large vessel, and then dye is added with minimal agitation to create beautiful semi-solid shades.
Multi – Hawthorne Multi is hand-painted to intentionally create surprising pops of color and variegation. 
Tonal – To create the complex tonal colors of Hawthorne Tonal, dyes in multiple shades are hand-painted on each skein.

Traditional tweed meets American wool with High Desert Tweed! Rich colors and eye-capturing neutrals were inspired by the Oregon high desert environment, and the flecks of tweed are reminiscent of the landscape dotted with sheep. Beyond the inspiration for its colors, High Desert is made with American-grown wool from the Shaniko Wool Company in Oregon. The irresistibly soft fibers are processed in South Carolina and dyed and milled in North Carolina to become this worsted-weight yarn.

High Desert Tweed is a great choice for cozy garments and accessories. Its tight twist provides beautiful stitch definition, and it makes wonderfully bouncy cables and textured stitches. The amount of tweed neps strikes the right balance to add interest without competing with complex stitch patterns, and the American wool is a luxurious blend of Merino and Merino-Rambouillet, incredibly soft fibers that are perfect for pieces worn next to the skin.

High Desert Tweed can be paired with High Desert Worsted for even more color options.

As light as a bubble and as soft as a teddy bear, Bubbly Bouclé takes luxury fibers to the next level of loftiness! Delicate loops of Merino and alpaca are spun around a nylon and Merino core to create a decadently light, textured yarn that’s irresistible to touch. The fluffy loops will obscure delicate lace and intricate stitches, but what is lost in stitch definition is gained in coziness. Crocheted at a denser gauge, Bubbly Bouclé creates an opaque, textured fabric, and at a looser gauge, it’s ever-so-slightly sheer with more prominent loops. With generous yardage and a lofty construction, you’ll be amazed at how little yarn is needed to create airy yet cozy projects that weigh next to nothing.
Bubbly Bouclé comes in a selection of sophisticated neutrals and vivid brights that are naturally lightly heathered due to the fiber blend absorbing color in different amounts. The range of shades is perfect for everything from garments to toys. Use Bubbly Bouclé’s brighter colors for textured fashion pieces and vintage-inspired sweaters, or choose the neutrals for a faux-fur look or to add fluffy accents to adorable figurines like gnomes, teddy bears, and sheep. 
Also available in an undyed, Bare version here.

View All.name: Berroco Remix Light
View All.description_miniatur: DK | 30% Nylon, 27% Cotton, 24% Acrylic, 10% Silk, 9% Linen
View All.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



REDUCE, REUSE, RECYCLE.
How are you greening your knitting? Reducing doesn’t seem like much fun, and reusing generally means you’ve had to rip out a failing project, a painful part of any knitter’s process. Enter Remix, a 100% recycled Berroco yarn made using a low-impact manufacturing process patented in France. 
HOW IS IT MADE?
Garments and high-quality commercially knit fabric panels left over from the ready-to-wear industry are collected from across Europe and sorted by fiber, then color. Because these pieces are pre-dyed, there is no need to dye them again, which saves water and prevents water pollution. Instead, colors are created by carefully blending garnetted fibers. Garnetted fiber is the result of shredding old textiles to make a new, fleece-like fiber that is ready to be spun into a new yarn.
Remix and Remix Light use a soft, comfortable blend of nylon, cotton, acrylic, silk, and linen. A tweedy, rustic look makes these yarns ideal candidates for casual knits, and their machine washability means any garment will be low maintenance and hard-wearing. The original Remix comes in an abundant 216-yard ball and knits to a worsted weight gauge, while Remix Light knits to a DK weight gauge and contains an incredible 432 yards per 100g ball. Finished garments are immediately cozy, with the feeling of well-loved jeans or your favorite old t-shirt.







                        Yarn Details

Minus Icon

A silky blend of cupro and Mulberry silk will have you reaching for this yarn for your next warm-weather make. Samia glides through your fingers as you work each stitch making it as much a pleasure to work with as to wear. A sensational blend of two fibers perfectly matched to keep you cool through the warm days. With a slight shine to the yarn, you are able to make garments that drape perfectly for seasonal wear.

Cupro is a type of rayon made from a by-product of cotton production. It is made from lint-like fibers and other cotton waste that can't be spun into cotton yarns. Instead, these fibers are chemically treated in a closed system in Japan and processed to produce a super-soft yarn with beautiful drape and shine. Mixed with a bit of Mulberry silk, this yarn is perfect for beautiful lightweight tops & accessories.

We recommend wet-blocking projects made with Samia. High heat from steaming too close to the project can damage the cupro.

View All.name: Berroco Remix
View All.description_miniatur: Worsted | 30% Nylon, 27% Cotton, 24% Acrylic, 10% Silk, 9% Linen
View All.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



REDUCE, REUSE, RECYCLE.
How are you greening your knitting? Reducing doesn’t seem like much fun, and reusing generally means you’ve had to rip out a failing project, a painful part of any knitter’s process. Enter Remix, a 100% recycled Berroco yarn made using a low-impact manufacturing process patented in France. 
HOW IS IT MADE?
Garments and high-quality commercially knit fabric panels left over from the ready-to-wear industry are collected from across Europe and sorted by fiber, then color. Because these pieces are pre-dyed, there is no need to dye them again, which saves water and prevents water pollution. Instead, colors are created by carefully blending garnetted fibers. Garnetted fiber is the result of shredding old textiles to make a new, fleece-like fiber that is ready to be spun into a new yarn.
Remix and Remix Light use a soft, comfortable blend of nylon, cotton, acrylic, silk, and linen. A tweedy, rustic look makes these yarns ideal candidates for casual knits, and their machine washability means any garment will be low maintenance and hard-wearing. The original Remix comes in an abundant 216-yard ball and knits to a worsted weight gauge, while Remix Light knits to a DK weight gauge and contains an incredible 432 yards per 100g ball. Finished garments are immediately cozy, with the feeling of well-loved jeans or your favorite old t-shirt.

View All.name: Baa Ram Ewe Woodnote Aran
View All.description_miniatur: Aran/Heavy Worsted | 34% Blue Faced Leicester, 33% Masham, 33% Merino
View All.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Woodnote’s blend of wool from three different sheep breeds creates a springy yarn with all of the best characteristics of wool. Bluefaced Leicester provides luster, drape, and durability; Masham provides a hint of sheen and loftiness; and Merino provides luxurious softness. This luxury British breed blend is a staple yarn in any stash, with each shade inspired by English woodland. This soft yarn is comfortably worn next to the skin, making it ideal for sweaters, scarves, and hats.
Bluefaced Leicester: Evolved during the last century in the Tyne & Wear Valleys and the hills of east Cumbria, this breed produces fine, long-staple wool that is known for its softness and luster. As well as being soft, this fiber also holds the strength needed to create long-lasting garments that can be treasured over time. With a broad muzzle and tightly curled, semi-lustrous wool, it is the dark blue skin on the sheep’s head that gave the breed its name.
Masham: Produced by crossing a Teeswater or Wensleydale ram with a Northern hill ewe such as the Swaledale or Dalesbred, this hardy sheep produces a soft, demi-luster fleece.
Merino: Developed in Spain, Merino sheep are world famous for having one of the highest quality fleece of any breed of sheep. The short and fine fibers used in Merino yarn create a luxurious and soft texture that has all the resilience needed to create a long-lasting piece of knitwear.

View All.name: Baa Ram Ewe Woodnote DK
View All.description_miniatur: DK | 34% Blue Faced Leicester, 33% Masham, 33% Merino
View All.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



Woodnote’s blend of wool from three different sheep breeds creates a springy yarn with all of the best characteristics of wool. Bluefaced Leicester provides luster, drape, and durability; Masham provides a hint of sheen and loftiness; and Merino provides luxurious softness. This luxury British breed blend is a staple yarn in any stash, with each shade inspired by English woodland. This soft yarn is comfortably worn next to the skin, making it ideal for sweaters, scarves, and hats.
Bluefaced Leicester: Evolved during the last century in the Tyne & Wear Valleys and the hills of east Cumbria, this breed produces fine, long-staple wool that is known for its softness and luster. As well as being soft, this fiber also holds the strength needed to create long-lasting garments that can be treasured over time. With a broad muzzle and tightly curled, semi-lustrous wool, it is the dark blue skin on the sheep’s head that gave the breed its name.
Masham: Produced by crossing a Teeswater or Wensleydale ram with a Northern hill ewe such as the Swaledale or Dalesbred, this hardy sheep produces a soft, demi-luster fleece.
Merino: Developed in Spain, Merino sheep are world famous for having one of the highest quality fleece of any breed of sheep. The short and fine fibers used in Merino yarn create a luxurious and soft texture that has all the resilience needed to create a long-lasting piece of knitwear.







                        Yarn Details
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon




Fiber Content:                     34% Blue Faced Leicester, 33% Masham, 33% Merino

CotLin is a cool and lightweight Tanguis cotton and summer linen blend perfect for washcloths, spa gifts, and summer garments for children and adults. Tanguis (tan-gwiss) cotton has a very soft hand, excellent absorption, and, because it is a naturally white fiber, a high affinity for dyes. The Belgian linen adds characteristic flecks and additional absorbency with very low elasticity - helping to alleviate stretching in the finished project. Summer linen has an extended growing period which results in a longer, stronger fiber. When blended with the already strong Tanguis cotton, it makes a durable, wearable, and soft yarn. The crocheted fabric will get softer with each wash too.

                    These small, undyed mini-hanks allow you to try out new fibers for a fraction of the price. The low yardage makes them ideal for whipping up swatches or for testing out your DIY dye experiments, without committing your time or wallet to a full size skein.

A hardy and soft superwash yarn in a versatile fingering weight! By selecting high grade wool (19.5 microns), we have been able to produce a machine washable yarn that is super soft. This lightweight version can be used for everything from shawls and accessories to lighter sweaters and colorwork projects. Create your own colors and color palettes to get exactly what you want. And with machine washable convenience, you can gift without fear and there's no need to worry about the care your knitting will receive!

View All.name: Twill Fingering - Bare
View All.second_description:
Yarn Description
                    Plus Icon
Minus Icon



You'll love having your fiber in a twist with this versatile lightweight yarn! Three plies of super soft Merino are tightly twisted together, resulting in a dense and springy yarn with tons of definition and body. Because of this compact construction, the yardage and weight can be misleading, with a lot more grams of merino goodness packed into each yard. At 20.5 microns, the fine grade Merino is particularly soft as well as superwash, for added machine washable convenience. 
The compact plying makes this yarn particularly resistant to pilling and more able to withstand the rigors of the washing machine, making it ideal for next-to-skin accessories like cowls, scarves, and hats or lighter garments that you'll want to touch. Immersion, hand-painting, and more will work well on this base, and 100% superwash wool will take dye all the way down to the core of the fiber to achieve rich, vibrant colors. We recommend testing dye techniques on a mini skein before dyeing a larger quantity.
